fact_claim: Microsoft's EBITDA margin was 52.8% in fiscal year 2024, based on $129.4B EBITDA and $245.1B revenue.
metric_definition: EBITDA margin = (Operating income + depreciation + amortization) ÷ total revenue, using GAAP FY2024 consolidated results.
discrepancy_notes: Computed with FY2024 totals: revenue $245.122B, operating income $109.433B, depreciation $15.200B, amortization $4.800B ⇒ EBITDA $129.433B and margin 52.8%.
updated_text: Microsoft delivered a 52.8% EBITDA margin in FY2024 (year ended June 30, 2024), deriving $129.4B of EBITDA on $245.1B of revenue, combining GAAP operating profit with depreciation and amortization.

fact_claim: Apple reported $391.035 billion in total net sales in fiscal year 2024.
metric_definition: Total net sales (Products + Services) from the GAAP consolidated statement of operations.
discrepancy_notes: Value represents $391,035 million; reconciles to 10-K XBRL fact (accn 0000320193-24-000123).
updated_text: Apple generated $391.0 billion in total net sales in FY2024 (fiscal year ended Sept 28, 2024), comprised of $294.9B in product sales and $96.2B in services per its GAAP filings.
